title: Why does Leaver buster punish people who re-connect?
body:
Exactly as title says, if someone re-connects it usually means that they didn't want to leave in the first place,
if someone afk's from rage or leaves for something else, those people don't usually re-connect and they are the people who should get leaver buster on them,
so why does it give warnings and punishments to people who dc and then re-connect?
most of these people spend the whole time worrying that they are letting their team down because of whatever problem that made them dc and are frantically trying to re-connect, so why are these people still punished?
can i have an answer from Riot please.

replies.body:
I think that you should be allowed to dc and then reconnect once or twice per day. My computer and internet connection are almost always fine but every couple of months I will get bugsplat and randomly dc from a game. I always reconnect and I know that other people have the same issue. Occasionally, other things happen to people as well, like computers overheating or a random drop in otherwise perfectly good internet connection. While these situations are frustrating to other members in the game, they are usually a one off occurrence. 

If things like having a toaster computer or unreliable internet connection cause multiple dc's per game or over a period of a couple of hours, then sure. The leaver buster system will help motivate people to sort these issues out but there should be a little leniency for one off dc (especially if you have proof of trying to reconnect or having reconnected in a short amount of time).

Often you see people who love to DC within the first five minutes of a match then come back after the twenty minute mark. The reason they do this is they want to know why the game hasn't finished yet, they want to get onto the next game they can ruin.
When they do come back these people will typically throw insults and what not trying to ruin the team's cool so that they will lose faster.


I see a lot of QQ in this thread by people going "Oh but such and such happens and you can't stop it" actually you can.
If you know there is a problem, or will be a problem then don't play. DON'T PLAY!
You either fix the problem, or wait for the problem to go away. Then you can play.

The individual has full control on if they get banned or not.
Over the past year I've had about seven events where I have dropped from a game, each one of those were actually beyond my control, but they were sporadic enough during the rein of the the old Leaver Buster that I didn't even get a warning.
Now I'm not the best LoL player, hell I'm not even the least %%%%ing toxic, but I refuse to be the reason my team loses. Even though I'm a jungle main and it's always the jungler's fault.

Everyday I want to play LoL or any other game that locks you in with match making I go through a check list:
-Are any telecommunications companies doing work in the area
-Is there a thunderstorm or any other potential cause of a black out
-Is my internet paid for
-Are any of my computer systems screwing up
-Do I have any prior commitments

If any of these will interfere with my playing LoL I wont play. End of story. That is it.


Freak occurrences are very rare, and in the majority of cases if it is a computer error you will have prior warning to it occurring in some form. If it's a blackout, usually you have warning for that too, like I don't know the MASSIVE %%%%ING BLACK CLOUDS OVER HEAD!
One's computer overheating I would never take as a valid excuse, because that is user neglect.



Overall I am seeing results from the New Leaver Buster, positive results. From Bronze to Diamond I see a lot less AFKers and DCers, and people like you want this system changed so it no longer gets results. What kind of logic is that?

If you don't want to be hit by the Leaver Buster it's simple, make sure you don't. Don't play under circumstances that would cause you to leave. END OF STORY.
